title: Immersive Virtual Reality (IVR) Learning Design for Understanding Architectural Spaces

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic architectural blueprints and spatial concepts, with VR device usage experience
context.additional_context: Students use personal devices (BYOD) to perform architectural design modeling and spatial analysis in virtual environments. The curriculum focuses on hands-on training with VR content and simulation tools.

learning_goals: Students can freely navigate 3D architectural spaces in virtual environments and explain structural features
Students can identify design model issues and propose improvements using IVE (Immersive Virtual Environment)
Students can exchange feedback on peers' designs using VR-based collaborative tools

resources: VR Headsets (Personal or Rental for Students)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
